We ate there twice.  Both times were excellent.  First for the menu del dia.  I ordered the salad, which was supposed,to come with either chicken or pork.  Sine I do not eat meat they substituted empanadas.  The salad was actually many salads,in one.  A plate of mixed greens with a caprese salad on one side,a roasted vegetable salad on another side and a roasted fruit salad with cheese and walnuts on the other.  It was very good.  The second visit was for wine and tapas, also very good.  Be warned that seating is very limited and I have,never seen this place be empty.
